thread.title: Latin American design firm opens executive office in Miami
thread.title_full: Latin American design firm opens executive office in Miami

author: Brian Bandell
title: Latin American design firm opens executive office in Miami
text: Weekly Edition Filled with “must read” stories, industry news and reporter insights, exclusive interviews with local business leaders, and expanded Top 25 Lists . Exclusive Online Tools Research the 3+ year digital archive, and People on the Move leads database download. Book of Lists Start using the digital Book of Lists today. Print subscribers receive the printed Book of Lists when published. Enlarge Juliana Fernandez, AEI Commercial interior design firm AEI has opened an office in Miami with four executives and plans to hire additional staff over the next year. The Bogota, Colombia-based firm opened an office at 78 S.W. 7th Street in Brickell City Centre. This is the first U.S. office for the 22-year-old company, which has 150 employees overall. Its clients have included Microsoft, Coca Cola, Citibank, DHL and HSBC. Juliana Fernandez, AEI AEI’s Miami office is led by Founding Partner Juliana Fernandez and Local Partner David Chason . “Our expansion in this market fills an under-served need for cutting-edge commercial design that is pursued by global brands, yet is competitive and attainable on a local level,” said Fernandez. "Our vast resources and technology, coupled with international expertise in a multitude of commercial industries, enables us to offer U.S. clients an advantage when seeking the finest interiors for their business at competitive pricing.” AEI’s South Florida client have included the proposed Naranza condo in Edgewater, Paramount Residential Mortgage Group in Miramar, and Holland & Knight. Brian Bandell covers real estate, foreclosures and health care. Get the latest news with our free daily newsletter. Click here to subscribe.
